articles.content:
Protocols Signed between DPRK and Cuban Governments 
    Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The protocol of the 23rd meeting of the Inter-governmental Economic, Scientific and Technological Consultative Committee and a 2005 protocol on the commodity exchange between the the DPRK and Cuba were signed in Pyongyang Monday.
 The protocols were signed by Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade of the DPRK, and Ricardo Cabrisas Ruiz, minister of Government who is leading the government economic delegation of Cuba.    
 A protocol on the fixation of prices and the principle of their application from 2004 to 2008 between the DPRK Ministry of Foreign Trade and the Cuban Ministry of Foreign Trade was concluded on Monday.

articles.content:
Greetings to Belize Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Said Musa, prime minister of Belize, on the occasion of the 23rd anniversary of the independence of Belize.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would further develop, the message wished him success in his work.

articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the chairman of the Inoki Office of Japan participating in the First International Martial Arts Games.
 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned by Kanji Inoki, chairman of the office.

articles.title: First International Martial Arts Games Close
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Cuban Government Economic Delegation
    Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, had a friendly talk with the government economic delegation of Cuba led by Ricardo Cabrisas Ruiz, minister of Government, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.
 On hand were Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, and Esteban Lobaina Romero, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Wreath Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
9th Pyongyang Film Festival Closes
articles.content:
Wreath Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
    Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councillors' corps here laid a wreath before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, at the Revolutionary Martyrs' Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Monday on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of her demise.
 The guests laid the wreath before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, woman commander of Mt. Paektu, who remained intensely loyal to President Kim Il Sung and devoted her whole life to the sacred cause of the country's liberation and the people's freedom and happiness, and paid silent tribute to her in profound reverence.    
 Written on the ribbon are letters "The revolutionary exploits of anti-Japanese war hero Comrade Kim Jong Suk will be immortal."
